abstract: United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announces that at least 19 people may have been infected by E coli after eating rotisserie chicken salad from Costco; reports five people are hospitalized, but no deaths have been reported.
lead_paragraph: At least 19 people may have been infected by E. coli after eating rotisserie chicken salad sold at Costco’s, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

headline.main: Chicken Salad From Costco Implicated in E. Coli Infections
headline.print_headline: Chicken Salad From Costco Implicated in E. Coli Infections

snippet: At least 19 people may have been infected by E. coli after eating rotisserie chicken salad sold at Costco’s, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
